title: Jeremy Paxman steps down as University Challenge host
description: The news comes a year after he revealed he had been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease.

title: Ted Baker set for £211m takeover by Reebok's owner
description: The bid by Authentic Brands, which also owns Elvis Presley's image rights, ends months of speculation.

title: Coronation Street actor Duggie Brown dies aged 82
description: The actor and comedian also starred in shows including Last of the Summer Wine and The Comedians.

title: Blackmore Bond collapse: FCA failed to act before people lost life savings
description: BBC Panorama reveals evidence suggesting the FCA could have acted earlier before a fund collapsed.

title: Polio vaccine in Pakistan: Two policemen guarding vaccinators shot dead
description: Gunmen kill police guarding a vaccination team in the latest local incident of anti-vaccine violence.

title: Ryan Giggs tells court ex-girlfriend and sister attacked him
description: Ryan Giggs says he "may have caught" the sisters, but did not mean them any harm.

title: Owami Davies: Police trawl through 50,000 hours of CCTV footage
description: The Met says the search for the student nurse continues to be a missing person inquiry.

title: UK weather: Thunderstorms warning as heavy rain hits
description: Parts of Scotland see a week's worth of rain, as weather warnings are in place in England and Wales.

title: GB's Laura Muir strolls to European 1500m final
description: Britain's Laura Muir begins the defence of her European 1500m title as she breezes into Friday's final on a sweltering morning in Munich.

title: Trade union anger over 26% cut civil service redundancy pay
description: Ministers say redundancy pay must be "affordable" as they seek to cut 91,000 civil service jobs.

title: Decision to hire man as period dignity officer defended
description: The appointment of Jason Grant to the first role of its kind in Scotland has sparked a heated debate.

title: Benjamin Mendy: Footballer tried to rape woman after shower, jury told
description: The 29-year-old is among seven women targeted by Premier League star Benjamin Mendy, it is claimed.

title: Sergio Gomez: Manchester City confirm signing of Anderlecht and Spain Under-21s defender
description: Manchester City confirm the signing of Anderlecht and Spain Under-21s defender Sergio Gomez on a four-year deal.

title: Inflation drives fastest fall in real pay on record
description: Wage growth is lagging behind soaring prices as households grapple with the rising living costs.

title: Have the Taliban kept last summer's promises?
description: Economic collapse and a U-turn on girls' education are the hallmarks of Taliban rule this past year.

title: Reading and Leeds festivals: Fans angry as Jack Harlow and Måneskin pull out
description: Rapper Jack Harlow and Eurovision winners Måneskin will be at the MTV Video Music Awards instead.

title: Hungry pig-on-the-loose apprehended in Great Yarmouth
description: The portly porker is found munching its way through several gardens in Great Yarmouth.

title: We built a Buddhist temple in an Edinburgh family home
description: Theravada Buddhist monks oversee huge restoration of their temple in a house in Edinburgh.

title: James Anderson: England bowler set to join illustrious list of stars to compete at the elite level after turning 40
description: As James Anderson prepares to play his first Test as a 40-year-old, BBC Sport looks at are other stars to produce at the highest level after celebrating that birthday.

title: Afghan contractors: 'I wish I'd never worked for the UK government'
description: Afghan contractors left behind when the Taliban seized power tell the BBC they feel betrayed.

title: County Lines: Cost of living crisis used by gangs to lure new recruits
description: More young people are being drawn into county lines drugs gangs for the money, a charity warns.

title: Dame Deborah James's mother on life without her daughter
description: Heather James spoke to BBC Breakfast about how her family owe it to her daughter to enjoy life.

title: Lauren Winfield-Hill takes on highly-trained service dog in Hundred fielding challenge
description: Oval Invincibles star Lauren Winfield-Hill tests her agility, accuracy and power in a fielding and catching challenge against Yellow, a highly-trained service dog.

title: What can we expect from Scottish Tory hustings?
description: What are the big issues likely to be for Liz Truss and Rishi Sunak at the Tory hustings in Perth?

title: The Papers: New Covid jab for autumn, and Heathrow chaos
description: A Covid jab that targets two strains of Covid in a world-first leads Tuesday's headlines.

title: Liz Cheney: Trump’s nemesis faces Republican day of reckoning
description: Wyoming Republicans decide on Tuesday if Liz Cheney is a defender of the constitution or a "swamp rat".

title: Oscars apology to Native American after 50 years
description: Sacheen Littlefeather rejected the award on Marlon Brando's behalf over representation in film.

title: Sikh boy becomes Burberry modelling first
description: Images of Sahib won the hearts of many online after becoming Burberry's first children’s model to wear a patka.

title: 'It shows a plethora of blackness': 20 years of 1Xtra
description: From big artists to huge cultural moments, Radio 1Xtra "has represented black culture" for 20 years.

title: The owners being forced to give up their pets
description: As the cost of animal care spirals, charities are going to extreme lengths to help families keep their pets.

title: ‘Gaza’s children are used to the death and bombing’
description: Families count the cost of the latest round of fighting between Israel and Palestinian militants.
